00002  * @brief   Minimal perfect hashing functions
00003  *
00004  * Methods for generating a minimal perfect hash.
00005  *
00006  * @author  John LaRusic

00009 #include "common.h"
00010 
00011 int
00012 arrow_hash_cost_list(int *cost_list, int cost_list_length, arrow_hash *hash)
00013 {
00014     int i;
00015 
00016     hash->num_keys = (cmph_uint32)cost_list_length;
00017     
00018     /* Memory allocation for vector holding the keys */
00019     hash->vector = CC_SAFE_MALLOC(hash->num_keys, char *);
00020     hash->vector_space = 
00021         CC_SAFE_MALLOC(hash->num_keys * ARROW_HASH_BUFFER_LENGTH, char);
00022     
00023     /* Populate vector */
00024     for(i = 0; i < hash->num_keys; i++)
00025     {
00026         hash->vector[i] = hash->vector_space + i * ARROW_HASH_BUFFER_LENGTH;
00027         sprintf(hash->vector[i], "%d", cost_list[i]);
00028     }
00029     
00030     /* Create hash with CMPH */
00031     hash->source = cmph_io_vector_adapter((char **)hash->vector, hash->num_keys);
00032     cmph_config_t *config = cmph_config_new(hash->source);
00033         hash->data = cmph_new(config);
00034         cmph_config_destroy(config);
00035         
00036     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00037 }
00038 
00039 void
00040 arrow_hash_destruct(arrow_hash *hash)
00041 {
00042     hash->num_keys = 0;
00043     cmph_destroy(hash->data);
00044     cmph_io_vector_adapter_destroy(hash->source);
00045     free(hash->vector_space);
00046     free(hash->vector);
00047 }
00048 
00049 unsigned int
00050 arrow_hash_search(arrow_hash *hash, int key)
00051 {
00052     char buffer[ARROW_HASH_BUFFER_LENGTH];
00053     sprintf(buffer, "%d", key);
00054     return cmph_search(hash->data, buffer, strlen(buffer));
00055 }
